response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: For the Zoo class, you can return an Iterator of the List of Animal objects in the Zoo class. However, returning an Iterator of a private List is not considered bad practice. It does not break encapsulation since the Iterator is not modifying the List directly, it only allows other classes to access the elements of the List.

For the Animal class, since it is a inner class of Zoo, you can access the private List of Animal objects in the Zoo class using the this keyword.

<<<explanation>>>: Returning an Iterator of a private List in the Zoo class is not considered bad practice. It allows other classes to access the elements of the List without modifying it directly. For the Animal class, since it is a inner class of Zoo, you can access the private List of Animal objects in the Zoo class using the this keyword.
